key_risks: High employee turnover and workforce challenges
Legal and financial risks from litigation and regulatory scrutiny
Dependence on global economic conditions and geopolitical tensions
controversies: Involvement in controversial government contracts with U.S. CBP and ICE
Data privacy and security issues, including the Marriott International hack
environmental_issues: Commitment to achieving net-zero emissions by 2025
social_issues: Employee experience concerns and high-pressure work environment
Backlash from employees over ethical concerns related to government contracts
governance_issues: Regulatory demands around data protection and cybersecurity
Potential legal liabilities from cybersecurity breaches

sources.title: Security firm Accenture breached, claim cybercriminals
sources.snippet: Private data allegedly belonging to more than 30,000 employees of multinational IT company Accenture is being sold by cybercriminals. The company denies tbreach. On June 19th, a threat actor listed a dataset for sale on a notorious hacker forum. The dataset allegedly belongs to Accenture, a US multinational IT services and consulting company.

sources.title: CBP reportedly terminates Accenture hiring contract | Immigration ...
sources.snippet: CBP reportedly terminates $297 million hiring contract with Accenture. According to news reports, CBP signed the contract in November 2017 to streamline the administration's border security-related hiring, in response to EO 13767.
